newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: MALAYSIA STOCKS - factors to watch - April 15.
newsitem.headline: MALAYSIA STOCKS - factors to watch - April 15.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Malaysian stocks on Tuesday:
* On Monday, the Dow Jones Industrial Average rebounded up 60.21 points to 6451.90, ending a three-day losing streak.

* The Kuala Lumpur Composite Index sank to a seven-and-a-half month low on Monday, to 1,101.09, a drop of 37.27 points or 3.27 percent on local cash calls and foreign selling. Sentiment is expected to remain shaky.
* Ringgit quoted at 2.5070/80 a dollar at around 0830 GMT on Monday, staying in its predicted range.
* "I think sentiment (in Kuala Lumpur stock) will improve slightly," said the head of research at a local securities firm, referring to the Dow's rebound.
* In corporate news, the Business Times reports electric utility Tenaga Nasional Bhd will use the Labuan offshore financial centre for its next international bond offering.
